alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 04 at 4:03AM HST until February 05 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .A medium size west northwest swell will peak today and drive surf up to high surf advisory levels along the exposed northern and western shores of the smaller islands. As this swell gradually diminishes tonight, a reinforcing northwest swell will arrive Saturday and maintain elevated surf. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Surf 14 to 18 feet along the north facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai and Maui. Surf 10 to 14 feet along the west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai. * WHERE...The north facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai and Maui. The west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.
